path: artifacts/Coinspect - Smart Contract Audit - SenseiStake v221028.pdf

project_path.SenseiStake: contracts/Coinspect - Smart Contract Audit - SenseiStake v221028/SenseiStake

findings.title: Extending exitDate indefinitely
findings.description: The platform owner can modify the contractsâ€™ exitDate to maximize their commission gains.

findings.title: Forcing users to accept a higher commission rate
findings.description: The platform owner can front-run users to force them to accept a higher commission rate.

findings.title: Invalid BLS signature leading to funds loss
findings.description: A malformed BLS signature will cause all funds to be lost forever.

findings.title: Losing funds due to reused validator keys
findings.description: Users' funds can be lost if the same validator public keys are used for different validators.

findings.title: Depositing to a previously staked validator
findings.description: Users could deposit funds to a validator that has been previously staked, putting their funds at risk.

findings.title: Missing NFT key parameters
findings.description: NFT key parameters are not displayed on marketplaces.

findings.title: Insufficient ERC721 checks
findings.description: Not checking ERC721 allowance for SenseiStake operations.

findings.title: Funding an unexpected validator
findings.description: Users can fund a validator with different conditions than expected.

findings.title: Hardcoded value
findings.description: Using hardcoded values instead of adjustable parameters.

findings.title: Broken tokenURI link
findings.description: The tokenURI link is broken, returning a 404 error.

findings.title: Losing staking commission
findings.description: SenseiStake can lose the service commission under certain conditions.

findings.title: TokenURI function lacks key parameters
findings.description: The tokenURI function does not include key parameters of the backed validator.

findings.title: Insecure ownership checking
findings.description: The endOperationService and withdraw functions require the caller to be the owner, which is an uncommon practice.

findings.title: Funding unexpected validator with different conditions
findings.description: When a user calls createContract, they may get an unexpected validator and exitDate if two users call this method simultaneously.

findings.title: Hardcoded value (32 ETH)
findings.description: Hardcoded constants used across the codebase for comparisons and checks are difficult to understand without context.
